group9.example: The instructions were simple and clear to follow.

group9.definition: a basic, essential, or uncomplicated element; a simple form or substance
group9.example: The recipe only required a few simples like flour, sugar, and eggs.

group9.definition: a level of quality or achievement that is considered acceptable or desirable
group9.example: The company has set high standards for customer service.

group9.definition: used or accepted as normal or usual
group9.example: This is a standard procedure for all new employees.

group9.definition: very small in size or amount
group9.example: She found a tiny frog in the garden.

group9.definition: of very great extent or quantity; immense
group9.example: The Sahara Desert is a vast expanse of sand and dunes.

group9.definition: suggesting the operation of supernatural influences; unearthly or uncanny
group9.example: The old house had a weird atmosphere that made everyone feel uneasy.

group10.definition: a collectible object such as a piece of furniture or work of art that has a high value due to its age and historical significance
group10.example: She inherited some valuable antiques from her grandparents.

group10.definition: belonging to or dating from a past era; old-fashioned or obsolete
group10.example: The antique clock in the living room is over a hundred years old.

group10.definition: giving out or reflecting a lot of light; shining
group10.example: The bright sun illuminated the room.

group10.definition: intelligent and quick-witted
group10.example: She is a bright student who excels in her studies.

group10.definition: a formal agreement or contract between two or more parties
group10.example: The two companies signed a compact to work together on the project.

group10.definition: closely and neatly packed together; dense
group10.example: The compact design of the new laptop makes it easy to carry around.

group10.definition: something that is not genuine; a forgery or imitation
group10.example: The art expert confirmed that the painting was a fake.

group10.definition: to create a forgery or imitation of something
group10.example: The company was accused of faking their financial reports.

group10.definition: not genuine; counterfeit or false
group10.example: She was wearing a fake diamond ring.

group10.definition: following or according with established form, custom, or rule
group10.example: She wore a formal dress to the wedding.

group10.definition: a gown for evening wear
group10.example: She looked elegant in her black formal.

group10.definition: A mythical or imaginary being of human form but superhuman size.
group10.example: The giant roamed the land, causing fear and awe among the villagers.

group10.definition: Of very great size or force; gigantic.
group10.example: The team faced a giant challenge in the final match of the season.

group10.definition: characterized by a great volume or intensity
group10.example: The loud music from the party next door kept me awake all night.

group10.definition: in a manner that produces a great volume or intensity
group10.example: She spoke so loud that everyone in the room could hear her.

group10.definition: relating to the present or recent times as opposed to the past
group10.example: They live in a modern house with all the latest technology.

group10.definition: a person who advocates or practices principles typical of modernism
group10.example: She is considered a modern in the art world for her innovative techniques.

group10.definition: tidy and well-organized
group10.example: She always keeps her desk neat and clean.

group10.definition: in a neat manner; neatly
group10.example: He folded the clothes neatly and placed them in the drawer.

group10.definition: having all the required or desirable elements, qualities, or characteristics; as good as it is possible to be
group10.example: She has a perfect attendance record.

group10.definition: make (something) completely free from faults or defects; make as good as possible
group10.example: She worked hard to perfect her dance routine.

group10.definition: a person or thing considered to be perfect
group10.example: He was her perfect match.

group10.definition: free from pretense or deceit; genuine
group10.example: She gave a sincere apology for her mistake.

group10.definition: of considerable importance, size, or worth
group10.example: She received a substantial raise after her promotion.

group10.definition: to a great or significant extent
group10.example: His income increased substantially over the years.

group10.definition: harmful or poisonous
group10.example: The chemical spill created a toxic environment for the wildlife.

group10.definition: fully in agreement
group10.example: The board members were unanimous in their decision to approve the proposal.

group10.definition: measuring a great distance from side to side
group10.example: The river was too wide to cross without a boat.

group10.definition: over a large area or distance
group10.example: His arms were spread wide.

group10.definition: a wide space or distance
group10.example: The car was parked at a wide between the two buildings.

group11.definition: enough or more than enough; plentiful
group11.example: The buffet offered an ample selection of dishes.

group11.definition: a quantity, rating, or the like that represents or approximates an arithmetic mean
group11.example: The average of 5, 7, and 9 is 7.

group11.definition: calculate or estimate the average of (a quantity, measurement, etc.)
group11.example: Let's average the scores of the students to determine the class average.

group11.definition: typical; ordinary
group11.example: She has an average talent in drawing.

group11.definition: very strange or unusual, especially so as to cause interest or amusement
group11.example: She wore a bizarre outfit that caught everyone's attention.

group11.definition: not sharp or pointed
group11.example: He cut the bread with a blunt knife.

group11.definition: direct in speech or manner, often rudely
group11.example: She is known for her blunt opinions.

group11.definition: a cigar whose wider end has been cut off
group11.example: He lit up a blunt and relaxed on the couch.

group11.definition: a basic, fundamental, or necessary part of something
group11.example: Water is an essential for life to exist.

group11.definition: absolutely necessary; extremely important
group11.example: Sleep is essential for good health.

group11.definition: having previously held a particular position or status; ex-
group11.example: She is a former colleague of mine.

group11.definition: a person who previously held a particular position or status
group11.example: The former of the company was invited to the event.

group11.definition: average in amount, intensity, quality, or degree
group11.example: He showed moderate interest in the proposal.

group11.definition: to make or become less extreme, intense, rigorous, or violent
group11.example: She tried to moderate her tone during the discussion.

group11.definition: required to be done, achieved, or present; essential
group11.example: Sleep is necessary for good health.

group11.definition: a thing that is required to be done, achieved, or present
group11.example: Food, water, and shelter are basic necessities of life.

group11.definition: specific or distinct
group11.example: She had a particular interest in art history.

group11.definition: a specific item or detail
group11.example: He paid attention to every particular of the plan.

group11.definition: a suggestion or cue
group11.example: She gave me a prompt to start my presentation.

group11.definition: to encourage someone to do something
group11.example: The teacher prompted the students to answer the question.

group11.definition: happening in a short amount of time; fast
group11.example: The rapid growth of technology has revolutionized the way we communicate.

group11.definition: a fast-moving body of water, typically in a river
group11.example: The kayak enthusiasts navigated through the rapids with skill and agility.

group11.definition: only one in number; not combined with anything else
group11.example: He lives in a single room apartment.

group11.definition: a record that has one song on each side
group11.example: I bought the latest single from my favorite band.

group11.definition: to choose or select something or someone for a specific purpose
group11.example: I will single out the best candidate for the job.

group11.definition: so delicate or precise as to be difficult to analyze or describe
group11.example: She made a subtle change to the recipe that greatly improved the flavor.

group11.definition: unpleasant or unattractive in appearance
group11.example: The old abandoned house was surrounded by overgrown weeds and had an ugly faade.

group11.definition: complete; entire; full
group11.example: I ate the whole pizza by myself.

group11.definition: all of something, including all its parts
group11.example: He couldn't eat the whole of the cake.
